title: [K-12] Trust-Based Interpersonal Skills Development for Educational Technology Consultants

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of educational technology and instructional design principles
context.additional_context: Conducted in real-time online environments using digital devices, targeting language education professionals

learning_goals: Learners can apply eight interpersonal skills (active listening, paraphrasing, summarizing, open/closed questioning, concept/procedure explanation, informal dialogue) to real-world cases in educational technology consulting processes.
Participants can practice strategic communication techniques for building trust with faculty members
Solutions can be proposed to reduce faculty resistance during technology integration by applying validated methods from counseling/medical fields
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
